CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 2 Up to date , bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) structure , in which the active layer consists of an interpenetrating blend of electron donating conjugated polymers and electron accepting fullerene derivatives , is still the most useful active layer structure for high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) polymer solar cells.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| bulk heterojunction (BHJ) structure |
| interpenetrating blend of electron donating conjugated polymers |
| electron accepting fullerene derivatives |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| interpenetrating blend of electron donating conjugated polymers |
| electron accepting fullerene derivatives |

The term "bulk heterojunction (BHJ) structure" is not a material name, but rather a type of structure that describes the interpenetrating blend of two materials (electron donating conjugated polymers and electron accepting fullerene derivatives) in polymer solar cells. Therefore, it is not included in the table. Similarly, "up to date" and "high power conversion efficiency (PCE)" are not material names, but rather descriptors of the material's properties.
